paper_title.ja: Distinct correlation between CeO┣D22┫D2 and YSZ in out-of-place and in-place mosaic dispersions of heteroepitaxial CeO┣D22┫D2/YSZ/Si(001) films
paper_title.en: Distinct correlation between CeO2 and YSZ in out-of-plane and in-plane mosaic dispersions of heteroepitaxial CeO2/YSZ/Si(001) films

description.en: The structural correlations including the lattice constants and the mosaic dispersions between CeO2 and yttria-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ) in CeO2/YSZ/Si(001) heteroepitaxial films have been investigated by out-of-plane and in-plane X-ray-diffraction techniques. The distinct linear correlations of the full width at half-maximum (FWHM) of the omega scan between CeO2 and YSZ have been found in both directions. CeO2 always has a 0.7degrees lower FWHM of the omega scan than YSZ in the out-of-plane direction, but has a 2.6degrees higher FWHM in the in-plane direction. A possible relationship between the out-of-plane and in-plane FWHMs of the omega scans has been demonstrated with a lattice-rotation model. Besides, the lattice constants of CeO2 are dependent on the FWHMs of the YSZ omega scans: as the FWHM is below 3.5degrees, CeO2 has a tetragonal distortion, and as the FWHM is higher than 3.5degrees, CeO2 exhibits a cubic structure without distortion. The results are of great interest, both for the fundamental understanding of the film-growth mechanisms and for potential applications.

paper_title.en: Distinct correlation between CeO2 and YSZ in out-of-plane and in-plane mosaic dispersions of heteroepitaxial CeO2/YSZ/Si(001) films

description.en: The structural correlations including the lattice constants and the mosaic dispersions between CeO2 and yttria-stabilized ZrO2 (YSZ) in CeO2/YSZ/Si(001) heteroepitaxial films have been investigated by out-of-plane and in-plane X-ray-diffraction techniques. The distinct linear correlations of the full width at half-maximum (FWHM) of the omega scan between CeO2 and YSZ have been found in both directions. CeO2 always has a 0.7degrees lower FWHM of the omega scan than YSZ in the out-of-plane direction, but has a 2.6degrees higher FWHM in the in-plane direction. A possible relationship between the out-of-plane and in-plane FWHMs of the omega scans has been demonstrated with a lattice-rotation model. Besides, the lattice constants of CeO2 are dependent on the FWHMs of the YSZ omega scans: as the FWHM is below 3.5degrees, CeO2 has a tetragonal distortion, and as the FWHM is higher than 3.5degrees, CeO2 exhibits a cubic structure without distortion. The results are of great interest, both for the fundamental understanding of the film-growth mechanisms and for potential applications.

paper_title.ja: Film thickness dependence of ferroelectric properties of c-axis-oriented epitaxial Bi┣D24┫D2Ti┣D23┫D2O┣D212┫D2 thin films prepared by metalorganic chemical vapor deposition
paper_title.en: Film thickness dependence of ferroelectric properties of c-axis-oriented epitaxial Bi4Ti3O12 thin films prepared by metalorganic chemical vapor deposition

description.en: The film thickness dependence of the ferroelectricity of c-axis-oriented epitaxially grown Bi4Ti3O12 thin films was investigated. The c-axis-oriented Bi4Ti3O12 films with thicknesses from 35 to 400 nm were epitaxially grown on (100)CaRuO3//(100)SrTiO3 substrates by metalorganic chemical vapor deposition. The dielectric constant and the coercive field of the films were almost independent of the film thickness. These values were about 151 and 18.8 kV/cm, respectively. The spontaneous polarization Ps was almost constant at 4.0 μC/cm2 and was independent of the film thickness above 140 nm. This value is almost the same as the reported value for the single crystal along the c axis. However, the Ps value decreased with decreasing film thickness below 100 nm. Moreover, the remanent polarization continuously decreased as the film thickness decreased below 400 nm. As a result, the ferroelectric property of the epitaxially grown Bi4Ti3O12 films also depended on the film thickness and was similar to that of simple perovskite-structured ferroelectric thin films, such as Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 and (Pb, La)(Zr, Ti)O3 thin films. © 2001 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Film thickness dependence of ferroelectric properties of c-axis-oriented epitaxial Bi4Ti3O12 thin films prepared by metalorganic chemical vapor deposition

description.en: The film thickness dependence of the ferroelectricity of c-axis-oriented epitaxially grown Bi4Ti3O12 thin films was investigated. The c-axis-oriented Bi4Ti3O12 films with thicknesses from 35 to 400 nm were epitaxially grown on (100)CaRuO3//(100)SrTiO3 substrates by metalorganic chemical vapor deposition. The dielectric constant and the coercive field of the films were almost independent of the film thickness. These values were about 151 and 18.8 kV/cm, respectively. The spontaneous polarization Ps was almost constant at 4.0 μC/cm2 and was independent of the film thickness above 140 nm. This value is almost the same as the reported value for the single crystal along the c axis. However, the Ps value decreased with decreasing film thickness below 100 nm. Moreover, the remanent polarization continuously decreased as the film thickness decreased below 400 nm. As a result, the ferroelectric property of the epitaxially grown Bi4Ti3O12 films also depended on the film thickness and was similar to that of simple perovskite-structured ferroelectric thin films, such as Pb(Zr, Ti)O3 and (Pb, La)(Zr, Ti)O3 thin films. © 2001 American Institute of Physics.
